description: How does empire affect our world? What are the relations between war and knowledge? What is the role of European history in providing us a framework with which we understand world order as it exists in contemporary times? What are the lineages of anticolonial thought and what are the trajectories of postcolonial critiques built on the histories of race, the other, the indigenous and the hybrid? This course takes up these questions while introducing students to ways in which they can think of empire and war as having produced the system of sovereign nation-states and the contemporary world order.
title: Empire, War, and World Order
